value.title: Link from a Power BI Paginated report to a Power BI report

value.title: Power BI and the On-premises Data Gateway: What is it?

value.title: Shared & Certified datasets in Power BI
value.excerpt: Let's take a look at the new shared and certified datasets feature in Power BI Desktop and the Power BI service. value.title: Tools to take Power BI to the NEXT LEVEL

value.title: Tracing with Log Analytics and Power BI
value.excerpt: With Log Analytics integration in Power BI, you can now capture Analysis Services trace events easily and over a longer period of time. Combined with the Power BI template report, you can gain a lot of insights into usage of your datasets. With more to come down the road!  Announcing long-term usage

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI

value.title: Build Your Own Power BI Audit Log; Usage Metrics Across the Entire Tenant
value.excerpt: Power BI dashboard and reports come with a usage metric, which you can see how users used this content. There is also another usage metrics across the entire tenant, which you can see it if you have access to Power BI Administrator account, under Admin Panel in the Power BI Service. However, what if

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IPziqmQgJFw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Create Customized Age Bins or Groups in Power BI
value.excerpt: Power BI has the built-in feature of creating binning for a numeric field such as age. However, the default binning will create bins of equal size. If you want to create bins of different sizes, then you need to create that as a custom column. Fortunately, Power Query has transformations that can help.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PjHgi7X3_Bw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Create Row Number for Each Group in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: If you want to create a row-number statically as a pre-calculation in Power BI, then Power Query has a very simple way of doing it; Add Index Column. However, the Index column creates the row number regardless of any grouping or categorization. sometimes you want to take that into account too. There
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jmzTHZK5z7g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Dataflow Vs  Dataset   What are the Differences of these two Power BI Components
value.excerpt: I have presented about Power BI dataflow and datasets a lot, and always one of the questions I get is: What is the difference between dataflow and dataset. So I thought better to explain it in a post and help everyone in that understanding. In this video, you will learn what the differences between these
